programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson goes on a four-day trek through the Kintail region of the north-western Highlands, examining the story of the Jacobite uprisings of the early 1700s along the way. He starts by visiting Iron Age dwellings in Shiel Bridge, and heads to the rebuilt castle on Eilean Donan, the original of which was destroyed after invading Spanish troops landed there and were attacked by British warships. Tony ends in Glen Shiel, the site of a climactic battle in 1719 where royalist troops defeated the rebels.

programme.title: Teleshopping

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: It was 30 years after the Romans invaded Britain that they were ready to take on the challenge of conquering the Lake District. With the toughest landscape they had encountered in the nation, peopled by a rebellious tribe, it was no small task, but within a few years, the whole of Lakeland was under their control. Tony Robinson tackles the journey by himself, walking 50 miles from Penrith to Ambleside and on to the Irish Sea at Ravenglass, discovering that the Romans encountered beauty and danger in equal measure.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson takes a four-day trek along the coastline between Plymouth in Devon and Falmouth, learning about the thriving smuggling trade in Cornwall during the late 18th century. The area's tiny secretive harbours, beaches and secluded coves were ideal for illicit imports such as tobacco and brandy, and the business was so huge it threatened the national economy. Along his route, visiting such beauty spots as Lantic Bay and Polperro, he encounters all sorts of reminders of the trade and meets descendants of those involved.

programme.title: Royal Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Calls to reinvestigate the suspicious death of King Ludwig of Bavaria in 1886, who died three days after he was declared insane and deposed from the throne.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Camera crews journey to the deepest parts of the world's oceans to explore the lives of their inhabitants, including fearsome predators with huge teeth, strange jellyfish and deep-sea sharks that lurk among the gigantic submerged mountains and volcanos. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: James concludes his examination of the social significance of cars by exploring how aspiration and new wealth were behind the development of some of the greatest models ever made. He tries to make sense of the baffling world of company car hierarchy by holding a travelling salesman race-off and indulges his 1980s urges with the twin delights of a Lamborghini and a Porsche. He also unveils his choice of the ultimate people's car - a vehicle that can lay claim to being the greatest in history.

programme.title: Madagascar
programme.desc: David Attenborough narrates the story of the island in the Indian Ocean, off the southeastern coast of Africa. It has an ecosystem that has stood in isolation for millions of years, and produced an array of wildlife that cannot be found anywhere else on the planet. He begins by observing lemurs in their habitat, male red giraffe-necked weevils fighting each other, the courting rituals of chameleons, and the behaviour of spiders and fossas.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson explores the history of the ancient kingdom on a walk from Melrose in the Scottish Borders to Holy Island off the coast of Northumberland. Over five days, he goes on the trail of one of Northumbria's greatest sons - Saint Cuthbert. Through the Tweed Valley and across the Cheviot Hills, it's a journey through a murky history laden with myth. However, by investigating the communities, power bases and landscape of seventh-century Northumbria, Tony aims to understand the pagan land in which Cuthbert spread his simple brand of Celtic Christianity.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: The presenter examines how the car industry in Germany and Japan blossomed following the Second World War, becoming manufacturing giants that far outstripped the Allied nations that had defeated them. He test drives some of the vehicles Germany and Japan produced during the post-war period, as well as an assortment of other classic cars, including E-Types and Mustangs. He also reveals the sad tale of the Austin Allegro, a vehicle that had a devastating impact on the British car industry.

programme.title: Madagascar
programme.desc: An observation of the wildlife that inhabits the narrow band of mountains and rainforest on the island's east coast, from ring-tailed lemurs living on an inhospitable peak, to forest-dwelling sifakas, small primates on the verge of extinction. The programme also focuses on the golden bamboo lemur, which is capable of consuming daily doses of cyanide, and looks at the fruit-rich treetops where red-ruffed lemurs defend their food and territory. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Marine life at the poles, where winter temperatures frequently fall to a numbing -40C. Even when the sun reappears in the spring, its weak rays take a long time to melt the ice. David Attenborough describes how wildlife including seals, whales, polar bears and penguins overcome the elements to survive through prolonged cold spells.

programme.title: The World at War

programme.desc: Tony Robinson travels along the north Norfolk coast through one of the least developed spots in Britain, finding out how the area maintained its rural, remote identity despite the dynamic industrial changes of the Victorian age. From the arrival of Bertie, Prince of Wales at Sandringham House to the opening of Cromer Pier, Tony's four-day walk sees him learn about key periods in the county's history. He explores prime shooting estates, purpose-built seaside resorts, salt marshes and disused railway lines as he discovers how powerful landowners were able to control development and even shape the railways to suit their needs.

programme.desc: An exploration of the effects of the eruption of volcanos in the ocean. From these violent beginnings emerge islands and coral reefs that are home to a vast array of wildlife, including giant manta rays and vampire bugs that thrive in the tropical snow, after a process that takes millions of years. programme.desc: The struggle for survival on the region's isolated islands, home to flightless parrots, burrowing bats, giant skinks and tree-dwelling kangaroos. The documentary reveals how the arrival of new species can upset the delicate natural balance, with disastrous consequences, and explores the human history of the region. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.

programme.title: South Pacific

Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris takes a railway trip across Canada, revealing how 2,500 miles of transcontinental railway was built against huge odds in just a few decades, helping to join together a vast wilderness of isolated communities and create the country that exists today. He begins his journey on one of the earliest sections of track to be built, on a train that is now a lifeline for hunters and fishermen. He then sees one of the biggest, most famous trains in the world - the Canadian, before heading for the Prairies, and on to the port of Vancouver. Along the way he also searches for Winnie the Pooh, crosses raging rivers and meets the descendant of a pioneering Yorkshire family who arrived here more than 100 years ago.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson travels along the north Norfolk coast through one of the least developed spots in Britain, finding out how the area maintained its rural, remote identity despite the dynamic industrial changes of the Victorian age. From the arrival of Bertie, Prince of Wales at Sandringham House to the opening of Cromer Pier, Tony's four-day walk sees him learn about key periods in the county's history. He explores prime shooting estates, purpose-built seaside resorts, salt marshes and disused railway lines as he discovers how powerful landowners were able to control development and even shape the railways to suit their needs.

Dick Clement and Ian La Frenais' popular comedy drama, starring Jimmy Nail, Kevin Whately and Tim Healy.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: The lads begin work on dismantling the historic Transporter Bridge, but tension between the Serbian and Kosovan workers soon starts slowing things down - and worries about Bomber's health add to their woes. Elsewhere, Mickey Startup dispatches hitman Teddy Platt to teach Moxey the error of his ways, while Oz has an eye-opening reunion with son Rod. Dick Clement and Ian La Frenais's popular comic drama, starring Tim Healy, Kevin Whately, Timothy Spall and Jimmy Nail.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Rosemary's old school friend Dorothy invites the duo to restore the gardens of her beautiful villa on the French Riviera so the property can be opened to the public. The plan arouses bitter hostility among the neighbours and long-held family secrets start to surface, leading to murder. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo are hired to investigate why newly planted roses at an upmarket preparatory school keep dying. After witnessing the arcane ritual of the Night of the Stag, they detect tensions between modernising headmaster Quentin Marshall and established members of his staff who are harbouring secrets someone is prepared to kill for. Drama, guest starring Anthony Andrews (Brideshead Revisited), with Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The green-fingered sleuths are hired to work behind the scenes of a garden makeover TV show, but Rosemary has an accident while standing in for the programme's star and ends up in hospital. Realising someone is trying to sabotage the series, Laura teams up with no-nonsense presenter Quinnie Dorell (Belinda Lang) to catch the culprit. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Philip Henderson is found dead in his field following an altercation the previous day with his neighbour Doug Randall about his failed crop. Suspicion falls on the neighbour and his new wife, who was known to have had ongoing problems with Philip over his unpaid bar tab at her pub. However, as Mike and the team dig further into the mystery more suspects come into play. Neill Rea stars.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: When a man is electrocuted during a typing contest with Crabtree and Louise Cherry, Murdoch suspects the reporter was the intended target.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: The death of a policeman in a Soho strip club introduces Gene and the team to their new boss, detective 'Super Mac'. After months of silence, Alex again starts receiving flashes from the present - as well as the attentions of a mysterious admirer - while Chris tries to impress Shaz with his credentials as a new man. Philip Glenister and Keeley Hawes star.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: A car chase ends with a fatal crash, and Gene is accused of causing death by dangerous driving, leading to increased tension with the local community. As Alex takes up the fight to prove her boss's innocence, she becomes concerned that he is being led into corruption by Super Mac - and to add to her problems, she begins to doubt her mysterious stalker's offer of a way home.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: Former colleague Julia Piper asks Kavanagh if he will fly out to the States and help her fight the appeal of a convicted murderer on death row. Once in the Land of the Free, he finds himself up against a governor determined to ensure sentence is carried out - and realises that where justice is concerned, the Americans sometimes just do not play cricket. Legal drama, starring John Thaw, Anna Chancellor and Lisa Harrow.

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: DI Pat North is assigned to look into a case that may clear a man convicted of murder eight years ago, and finds that DS Walker was in charge of the original inquiry. Drama, starring Kate Buffery, David Hayman and James Wilby.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the Headland Garden in Polruan, Cornwall - one of the participants opening its havens to the public in the National Gardens Scheme - where plants face the harsh conditions of salt air and high winds.

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Anita Dobson guests as Phil Hunter's mum Lynne, who turns up at the station to lecture him on his responsibilities as a father-to-be. Smithy seizes an opportunity to meet local villain's wife Louise Larson and continue their dangerous relationship, while Adam struggles to make headway with his road safety campaign, until old friend Isaac Collins pulls a few strings at the local council to help get it under way. In court, the case against Terry's brother Ben concludes - but the outcome promises to have a devastating long-term effect on the entire family.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: A Small Price to Pay - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of three. Gina returns to her job immediately after receiving treatment for her cancer. Clearly unfit for work but too stubborn to admit it, she relies on June to oversee the relief. Gary is shot during a raid on a gang suspected of handling stolen goods, while Phil bristles with righteous indignation at the discovery that Kate has been mugged at knifepoint and vows to catch the thug responsible. As for Adam, he hits another snag as he tries to get his road safety initiative up and running, and again asks Isaac Collins to help - unaware his old friend's shady past is about to catch up with him.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: A Small Price to Pay - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of three. Jack embarks on a relentless search for the gunman who shot Gary - and soon realises the finger of suspicion is pointing firmly at Adam's friend Isaac Collins. Smithy and Jonathan call at Gina's house to see why she hasn't turned up for work, and discover her unconscious on the bathroom floor. Away from the line of duty, Tony feels dejected at not having a date for Honey's birthday party and decides to hire an escort for the evening - little anticipating the surprise awaiting him.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: A Small Price to Pay - Part Three
programme.desc: Part three of three. Adam learns the Borough Commander has been sent photos of him smoking marijuana, and decides to resign before he's unceremoniously thrown off the force. Rochelle continues her steamy illicit affair with Dan, while Jack questions Neil about his relationship with Suzie Sim and receives a bland assurance that it's all professional and above board - but later sees the pair in a compromising position.

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: A surveillance team is sent into the restaurant to catch one of Henry's regulars in the act of bribing an MP. Drama, starring Richard Griffiths.

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Henry cooks a banquet for a visiting Japanese delegation, and tracks down a criminal from his past, hitherto presumed dead. This shocking discovery prompts him to investigate corruption in the police force. Richard Griffiths stars.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Dwelling Place
programme.desc: Feature-length adaptation of the best-selling novel, telling the tale of a 16-year-old struggling to keep her five brothers and sisters out of the workhouse with the help of a kindly carpenter. Starring James Fox, Tracy Whitwell and Edward Rawle-Hicks.

programme.title: Oliver Twist
programme.desc: Part one of two. Adaptation of Charles Dickens' story. An orphan boy endures a horrible childhood in the workhouse, but yearns for more. After being sold to a cruel undertaker, he runs away to London - where he joins a group of pickpockets. Timothy Spall heads an all-star cast as Fagin, with support from Tom Hardy, Gregor Fisher, Sarah Lancashire, Sophie Okonedo, Julian Rhind-Tutt and William Miller in the title role.

programme.title: Oliver Twist
programme.desc: Part two of two. Sikes escapes back to London with a badly wounded Oliver, while Mr Bumble declares his love for Mrs Corney - and captivated by the promise of social advancement, she agrees to marry him. Later, Nancy stumbles on a secret meeting, during which she overhears Monks telling Fagin he wants Oliver dead in two days.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Ursula insists the midwives do not become emotionally involved with their patients, but her harsh new approach proves hard to cope with in the face of two devastating cases. A father-to-be is badly injured in an explosion, leaving him unable to work to support his family, and a couple with dwarfism expecting their first child are warned that their child may be stillborn, a situation that leaves Patsy confronted with one of the hardest decisions of her life.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Philip Henderson is found dead in his field following an altercation the previous day with his neighbour Doug Randall about his failed crop. Suspicion falls on the neighbour and his new wife, who was known to have had ongoing problems with Philip over his unpaid bar tab at her pub. However, as Mike and the team dig further into the mystery more suspects come into play. Neill Rea stars.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: The search for an abducted student leads nowhere until a 'psychic adviser' to the missing girl's mother approaches the police, offering to help track her down. Burke grudgingly agrees to attend one of her shows and is stunned by the accuracy of information he is given about his father that no-one else could possibly know. Drama, starring Alex Norton and Blythe Duff.

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: New eye-witness testimony and a television documentary about the McCready case casts doubt on the original murder investigation. DS Walker is suspended from duty and decides to return to Glasgow to find new evidence to prove his innocence, in order to save his career, relationship and reputation.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Snooker player Dennis Taylor asks Lovejoy for help finding a billiards table that once belonged to Mary Queen of Scots. Drama, also starring Ian McShane.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward explores the historic city of Warwick as part of her National Gardens Scheme tour, discovering medieval buildings and the gardens of Lord Leycester Hospital.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Those involved in Bert's death and its subsequent cover-up search for inner peace. Sarah battles her own demons, but is aware that Colin's suffering is greater. Meanwhile, James' treatment continues to cause him suffering and Jack is determined to find answers after Carolyn's revelation. Romantic drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.sub-title: A Kiss to Build a Dream On
programme.desc: Elizabeth enlists Prudence's help, and on the eve of her engagement party, Sarah confides to her aunt about a shameful secret. Meanwhile, Anna and Gino's relationship moves forward and James' treatment takes a disturbing turn. Romantic drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jack takes over as superintendent in Adam's absence, and promotes Neil Manson to acting DCI - despite grave misgivings about his recent conduct. Gabriel publicly asks Sheelagh out for dinner, allaying her fears that their relationship is over, and Ramani is devastated to learn Terry has been having an affair with his sister-in-law. Affairs of the heart also preoccupy Dan Casper, who receives another poison pen letter - but decides to ignore it and continue his affair with Rochelle.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Helena develops complications following Nick's rushed surgery, putting Diane in a difficult position when she realises the problem should have been noticed during the first operation. Sam breaks the rules to help a recovering alcoholic who needs a heart transplant, and Justin tries to flirt with Kyla again. Jesse Birdsall guest stars.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A bogus paramedic causes chaos among the staff and patients of Holby City, and a mugging incident results in Adam having to reveal a secret. Medical drama, starring Ian Bleasdale and Cathy Shipton.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: To Catch a Killer - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of three. Jack is forced to arrest his own son Benjamin for possession of drugs, and the corpulent form of convicted rapist Peter Baxter again crosses Sam's path as she helps Ramani investigate a nurse's disappearance. Gabriel invites Sheelagh back to his place in a bid to prove that he has finally managed to forget about Kerry Young, while Yvonne is summoned to hear her fate as the inquiry into the death of Lee Chapman concludes.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pauline and Arthur reflect on their marriage and parenting skills when their son Martin is suddenly taken to hospital. Pat moves in with Nick and her grandson much to Nigels dismay.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Frank and the Mitchell brothers take Sharon, Kathy and Pat to France on a booze cruise, will romance bloom for the couples or will it all end in classic EastEnders fashion.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Billy is rescued from a tank of caustic soda and rushed to hospital in agony while Nick returns to work just as a bombing campaign presents the team with a fresh challenge.

programme.desc: Lexie's plans to organise a clan gathering, which include hiring a film crew, look set to be thwarted when pernickety Charles MacDonald throws a spanner in the works. Duncan and Jess struggle to admit their feelings for each other and Molly prepares to make a confession. Scottish drama, starring Dawn Steele and Susan Hampshire.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: A humiliated and jealous Evelyn exacts revenge by spreading the sordid secrets of Karen's past around Skelthwaite and patients soon refuse to be treated by her, leaving it up to Anna to discover why a teenage epileptic continues to suffer attacks despite his medication. Simon struggles to cope with the preparations for his forthcoming wedding and proves easy prey for Evelyn, who seems intent on wreaking as much havoc as she can.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sisters Sharon and Tracey's lives are changed for ever when their husbands leave for work and never return. First episode of the popular comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie puts Marlene under pressure to fit in with the locals, so she decides to take up cookery - an idea that does not go down well with her family. She orders her husband to pick blackberries for a pie, causing him to inadvertently trespass on the land of his anti-English neighbour. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean falls out with Lionel, but the tense atmosphere between them does not prevent a visit from her sister-in-law Penny and husband Stephen. Bob Larbey's comedy about late-blossoming love, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy accepts Sid's challenge to play a round of golf - despite not having touched a club since 1939. Brian Wilde and Sid Comer star.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The duo are called out to a private zoo, where human remains have been found in the tigers' den. The evidence points to an unfortunate accident, but Dalziel suspects foul play - and a connection to a mysterious disappearance he investigated 20 years previously. Detective drama, starring Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team reinvestigates the killing of notorious biker-gang leader Eddie Chapman when his son's girlfriend brings them new information about his death. Meanwhile, Sandra is forced to reassess her position at Ucos when a former colleague suggests she is wasting her career. Starring Amanda Redman, with her real-life daughter Emily Glenister in a supporting role.

Trevor Eve stars, with Sue Johnston and Tara FitzGerald.

Joseph's condition grows noticeably worse, and a prison inmate is admitted to the hospital after being injured in a riot. Former EastEnders actor Todd Carty guest stars.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Sean is devastated to discover the truth about Max and Tina, and Adam feels pressured to reveal his secret. Meanwhile, Patrick is amazed when a blind man inexplicably regains his sight - could it be a miracle? Medical drama, starring Gerald Kyd, Pal Aron and Ian Kelsey.

programme.desc: Richard goes green with jealousy when he sees Phil and Kathy together, Nigel confronts Nick as he tries to steal his mothers furniture and Arthur comes clean about his double life.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: The locals bid an emotional farewell to Vic and Lucy, and Simon's problems continue to mount as his business crumbles and he is consumed by guilt over his fling with Evelyn. Elsewhere, a dishy gardener steals the heart of a wheelchair-bound patient, while Tom and Beth take advantage of a drunken Joe's incapacity and steal a kiss. Rural drama, starring Thomas Craig and Tony Haygarth.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: The sisters face up to the realities of life with their husbands in prison, and try to explain things to Tracey's son, Garth. Classic comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Marlene allows Boycie to buy a maximum of six cows for the farm - and is less than impressed when Elgin, Jed and Bryan turn up with a herd of 300. The vet is called out when Rocky the bull fails to take any notice of the females, and Tyler prepares to sit a local private school's entrance exam. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel is concerned that he has no pension plans, so the ever-resourceful Alistair comes up with an ingenious idea - to sell the country house. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo's nephew is getting married, and while the groom's uncle considers having a bath to mark the occasion, Foggy fears disaster will befall the happy couple.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: The judge presides over the case of a man who killed a paedophile, an act that Jo defends by arguing it protected further victims from abuse. Meanwhile, she meets the real father of the boy she is trying to adopt, and begins seeing him socially - sending Deed into a fit of jealous rage. Martin Shaw and Jenny Seagrove star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team reinvestigates the murder of a man found in an alleyway seven years previously when he is identified on a website covering unexplained disappearances. The victim is named by a woman whose husband hired him six months before his death, but neither of them had thought anything of it when their employee went missing - and seem to know little about him. Meanwhile, Brian and Gerry are distracted by looming job cuts and fear that Ucos could be downsized. With Robert Daws and Claudie Blakley.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A woman who went missing from a care home in 1986 is found murdered in a burnt-out car, and the team discovers she had recently abducted a teenage girl herself. As the investigation continues, both cases appear to be linked to an urban myth about a character known as the Bag Man - an eyeless villain who kidnaps children. With Eva Birthistle, Tara FitzGerald and Wil Johnson.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Sequel to The White Queen, set in the Middle Ages and picking up as the tumultuous War of the Roses comes to an end, a new generation ascends to the throne in a tale of power, political clashes, family, love and betrayal. As the victor of the Battle of Bosworth, Henry Tudor, is set to ascend the throne and Elizabeth of York and her family, supporters of the former King, find themselves in grave danger. Lizzie must fulfil her promise to marry King Henry VII and bring peace to the nation. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: King Henry VII sets out to establish himself as the new sovereign, but finds a dangerous, deeply divided kingdom. Lizzie's loyalties are further complicated by the child she is expecting. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

Romantic drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp.

programme.desc: Sarah is closer to George than ever after her triumph at the Swansons' party. However, their happiness is short-lived when they are faced with Regina's bombshell, which sends shockwaves through Inverness. Romantic drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Amy plucks up the courage to audition for a band and a hungover Sean is forced to rethink his life when a friend needs his help. Tim Jenkins, an old friend of Sean's, overdoses.

Molly is horrified to learn there is a thief on the estate, while Highland Radio Authority officer Parker is on the trail of pirate station Rob Roy Radio. Drama, starring Susan Hampshire, Dawn Steele and Hamish Clark.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: The Skelthwaite Scorpions play a crunch match against rival team the Bridlington Trawlers, but fare badly, prompting David to demand a return engagement. Meanwhile, Anna's distress at her split with Simon is compounded by the financial hardship of running a business single-handed _ but just as disaster looms, a shady businessman makes her an offer for the factory. Lesley Dunlop and Philip Middlemiss star.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon spreads her wings and takes full advantage of her sister's hospitality, but Tracey is having money worries. Ross Kemp guest stars, with Linda Robson and Pauline Quirke.

John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.desc: Bacchus and Gently arrive in a small town to investigate the apparent suicide of a mill manager who has been found hanged. However, the detectives begin to suspect foul play as they discover money has gone missing and the victim's widow reveals he was having an affair. Starring Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team investigates the killing of a zookeeper, thought to have been mauled to death by a tiger in 2006, when blood found in the victim's lodgings suggests he was murdered before his body was placed in the big-cat enclosure. However, not all the team members are happy about the new case as Brian's animal rights tendencies come to the fore, bringing him into conflict with the zoo's PR. Alun Armstrong and Amanda Redman star.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The body of a Falklands War veteran who became one of the leading lights in the campaign against nuclear weapons is found in a stretch of river running underneath the Ministry of Defence. As Boyd and the team set about investigating the man's former allies, they stumble upon footage of an incident intelligence services had tried to cover up - and Grace is reunited with a former lover from her own time in the anti-nuclear movement. Drama, starring Trevor Eve and Sue Johnston, with Jack Shepherd (Wycliffe, Into the Storm), John McArdle (Brookside) and Anna Chancellor (Four Weddings and a Funeral, Spooks).

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Elizabeth struggles through her labour, while King Henry's envoys embark on a diplomatic mission to Burgundy, a York stronghold abroad. Negotiations are jeopardised by a twist of fate, and Lizzie learns she has more in common with her husband than she first imagined. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: The York princesses are strategically married off to strengthen the Tudor cause, but further political challenges are on the horizon. When King Henry finds himself back on the battlefield to protect his reign, Lizzie learns that the threats they face may be closer to home. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

Lisa visits local organic juice producers before James joins TT legend John McGuinness as he and his team prepare for the race, treating the bikers to lamb chops with hispi cabbage and an olive glaze.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: Supermarkets & Supply Chains: Keeping Britain Fed? Tonight
programme.desc: As Britain and Europe remain locked down in the fight against Covid-19, Julie Etchingham asks how seriously the food supply chain is being affected. Crops will be ready to be harvested in the coming weeks, but there may be no labour available. She looks at how shops, supermarkets and delivery services are coping now the early panic buying is over. And she asks, if vulnerable families cannot get access to food at prices they can afford, will people ultimately be forced to change the way they eat?.

programme.title: Gordon, Gino and Fred: American Road Trip
programme.desc: For the final leg of their US jaunt, the trio arrive in Texas, a meat-lover's paradise where Gordon Ramsay is keen to introduce his companions to some of the best barbecue food known to man. In Lexington, Gordon turns lumberjack in an attempt to fell a dead oak - which is used to infuse ovens with wood smoke. There's a break for a bit of skinny dipping, before the trio fish go fishing, and stay in a strange cabin deep in the woods, surviving on beans and bourbon. They then hit the state capital of Austin, dressing as cowboys in the local bar and at the rodeo, before one last barbecue supper of slow-smoked beef brisket, pork ribs and spicy sausage.

programme.title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories
programme.desc: Michael Parkinson finds himself on the opposite side of the talk show format, as he discusses his life and career with Piers Morgan. The veteran host looks back on his encounters with some of the world's biggest stars, including Fred Astaire and Madonna, as well as what is perhaps his most famous moment, a powerful series of interviews with Muhammad Ali. He also reflects on his roots in a Yorkshire mining village, the death of his father, and his struggle with alcohol and the impact it had on his otherwise successful 60-year marriage.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: The chef is joined by Brian Turner to explore the culinary delights of his native Yorkshire, with James visiting Frances Atkins' restaurant The Yorke Arms, where he enjoys her signature dish al fresco in her unusual dining room the Onion. Brian tastes the delights of some local charcuterie and is challenged to some off-road driving, while James brushes up his clay-pigeon shooting skills.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott's culinary tour reaches North Africa and the Moroccan city of Marrakesh. He visits a restaurant famous for cooking whole lambs in an underground oven, has a masterclass from local chef Cedric, who shows him how to make traditional food with a fancy twist, and hits the main square for some street food. Throughout the show he prepares flat breads with tomato salsa, barbecue corn on the cob with local spice spicy ras el hanout and whole fish with chermoula.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: DCI Tom Barnaby reluctantly joins wife Joyce on a spa weekend at Swavely Manor, a country house offering treatments to soothe the mind and body. However, as he attempts to unwind, a woman is found dead in a flotation chamber and he promptly abandons his therapy to investigate - but the body count soon rises. The detective eventually wraps up the case, but it proves to be his last as he makes a big decision about his future. John Nettles' final appearance in the long-running series, with guest stars Ronni Ancona, Geraldine James and Lesley Manville.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard invites comedian Joel Dommett, reality star Lydia Bright and actress Sarah Hadland to take part in a special edition of the quiz show, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Members of the public compete alongside celebrities Rickie Williams, Melvin Odoom and Laura Crane, and those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK.

programme.title: Through the Keyhole
programme.desc: Radio DJ and TV presenter Marvin Humes, Good Morning Britain's Kate Garraway, and comedian Jimmy Carr form the panel this time, as Keith Lemon is given another chance to rummage around the homes of three more mystery celebrities. As he tours the home, he points out items and features that might offer clues to the owners' identity, and challenges the studio panel to come up with the right answer to the question, 'who habitates in a house like this?'.

programme.title: The Departed (2006)
programme.desc: A cop infiltrates the inner circle of a feared Boston mobster, unaware a fellow officer is already an informant on the gangster's payroll. When both the crooks and the police discover they have a mole in their ranks, the two detectives realise they are in sudden danger and try to expose each other. Martin Scorsese's Oscar-winning thriller, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Matt Damon, Jack Nicholson, Mark Wahlberg, Martin Sheen and Alec Baldwin.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott continues his tour of the Moroccan city of Marrakesh, beginning with a pottery lesson from a man who has been making pots for more than 50 years. He also hits the souks in search of local pastries, reveals the secret of a perfect cup of mint tea and learns how to prepare a classic tanjia, which is taken to be cooked in the fire of a neighbourhood hammam. Along the way he cooks harissa and preserved lemon chicken skewers, and tagine.

Plus, the duo also provide some handy tips on tomato-based recipes, including baked Mexican eggs in a spicy sauce, Bloody Mary and tomato and shallot tart, while Lisa also prepares blondies.

programme.title: Junior (1994)
programme.desc: A fertility expert pioneers a treatment enabling men to become pregnant and carry babies to full term. When the authorities cancel funding for the research, he decides to test it on himself, but gives little thought to how difficult it will be to keep it a secret. The situation is further complicated when he starts to fall for the woman whose child he is carrying. Comedy, with Arnold Schwarzenegger, Danny DeVito, Emma Thompson and Frank Langella.

programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents the game show in which four relatives team up - this week the Telfers from Milton Keynes - and pit their wits against one of the finest quiz brains in the country, in the hope of taking away thousands of pounds.

programme.title: Van Der Valk
programme.desc: Marc Warren steps into the shoes of Barry Foster to take on the role of Dutch detective Van der Valk in this updated adaptation of the Amsterdam-based crime drama. Two seemingly unrelated men are found murdered in different parts of the city on the same day. Are the deaths connected, and if so, could there be a link to the disappearance of a student activist? Commissaris Van der Valk must uncover the truth while also dealing with an over-eager rookie cop joining his tight-knit team. Maimie McCoy, Luke Allen-Gale and Elliot Barnes Worrell co-star.

programme.title: Our Queen at War
programme.desc: How the life of the young Princess Elizabeth was shaped by the events of the Second World War, and the extraordinary experiences she went through during her teenage years. The film draws on archive material and interviews with people who shared her experiences, and royal experts explore how she was transformed from a shy princess into Queen Elizabeth II and Britain's longest reigning monarch.

programme.title: Secrets of the Driving Test
programme.desc: Grandmother Wendy is confident of passing but she is barely in the driving seat before nerves take hold. Seventeen-year-old boy racer Callum reckons he is more than test-ready, although his mum is not so sure, and Hull woman Shaunna returns after her failure in episode one. This time though she has a secret weapon and is determined to make it 13th time lucky. Narrated by Alan Carr.

programme.title: A Very British Lockdown: Diaries from the Frontline
programme.desc: Documentary featuring a wide cross-section of people as they record their own stories on camera phones - charting the everyday courage, kindness, anxiety and humour they experience as the nation strives to 'Keep Calm and Carry On'. From shopkeepers to home-schooling parents, care workers to cleaners, teachers to nurses, the film reveals what HM The Queen recently called 'our quiet, good humoured resolve'. Others - such as expectant Mums and the sick and elderly - show their bravery in the face of the coronavirus.

programme.desc: James samples the culinary delights of Northern Ireland with friend and fellow chef Paul Rankin, visiting a wasabi farm and a honey producer. James cooks overlooking the dramatic backdrop of Slieve Gullion - the highest point in Armagh - before the pair visit Lough Neagh.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five police officers answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Ian, Sally, Kayleigh and Peter pit their wits against a ruthless quiz genius in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Dawn is shocked when the foster parents arrive and accuse Will of threatening them, while Jamie secretly plans to meet up with Belle, and Vanessa asks Rhona to be Johnny's guardian in the event of her death.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Yasmeen receives a shocking diagnosis from Dr Gaddas, leading Geoff to immediately accuse her of infidelity, while Dev makes matters worse for Asha, who begs him to withdraw his complaints. Gary warns Claire that if Rick finds out she has been pocketing his cash, he is likely to kill her.

programme.title: Coronavirus: Q&A
programme.desc: Nina Hossein puts viewers' questions on a range of subjects relating to the Covid-19 outbreak to a panel of expert guests.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and his team head to Shrewsbury in Shropshire to meet former nurse Gina Constable, who has raised over a quarter of a million pounds for the Air Ambulance charity over the past 21 years. Inspired by the wishes of her late husband, the team set to work transforming her garden into a breathtaking Japanese-inspired outdoor space, complete with cloud-pruned trees and Japanese maples.

programme.title: Beat the Chasers
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts a spin-off from The Chase in which contestants take on two, three, four or all five of the quiz's resident experts Mark Labbett, Anne Hegerty, Paul Sinha, Jenny Ryan and Shaun Wallace at once. Members of the audience are called out to face five multiple choice questions, with the chance to bank up to 5,000, but if they get the first question wrong they are out. Next, contestants are given the option of playing between two and all five Chasers for increasing amounts of money, but with a decreasing time advantage against them..

programme.title: Gordon, Gino and Fred: American Road Trip
programme.desc: For the final leg of their US jaunt, the trio arrive in Texas, a meat-lover's paradise where Gordon Ramsay is keen to introduce his companions to some of the best barbecue food known to man. In Lexington, Gordon turns lumberjack in an attempt to fell a dead oak - which is used to infuse ovens with wood smoke. There's a break for a bit of skinny dipping, before the trio fish go fishing, and stay in a strange cabin deep in the woods, surviving on beans and bourbon. They then hit the state capital of Austin, dressing as cowboys in the local bar and at the rodeo, before one last barbecue supper of slow-smoked beef brisket, pork ribs and spicy sausage.
